intro: Calystegia subacaulis, commonly known as the slender bladderbladder, is a flowering plant native to the United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae, which includes morning glories and similar vines. The plant is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and heart-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-white, with a distinctive bladder-like structure at the base of the corolla. Calystegia subacaulis thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks.
